structure.unit: PHYSICIANS, OSTEOPATHS, PODIATRISTS, AND RELATED MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS

law.text: All fees collected by the board under the provisions of KRS 311.550 to 311.620, or the rules and regulations adopted pursuant thereto, shall be paid into the State Treasury and credited to a trust and agency fund to be used by the board in defraying the costs and expenses of the board in the administration of KRS 311.550 to 311.620, including, but not limited to, salaries and necessary travel expenses. No part of this fund shall revert to the general funds of this Commonwealth.
law.history: Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 348, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1996. -- Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 87, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1994. -- Reenacted 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 218, sec. 16. -- Created 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 150, sec. 14, effective June 19, 1952.
